summary: listen to events on multiple html elements

ports.name: Elements
ports.text: The HTML DOM elements to add the listener to

ports.name: Use Capture
ports.text: If multiple elements register an event listener, setting Use Capture will make sure the listener will be called before the regular (bubble) listeners. For more infos read here: javascript.info/bubbling-and-capturing.

ports.name: Prevent Default
ports.text: If set the default browser action for the event will not be executed. See [developer.mozilla.org](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/preventDefault)

ports.name: Stop Propagation
ports.text: Stops other elementsâ€™ event listeneres from getting called. See [developer.mozilla.org](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/stopPropagation)

ports.name: Event Trigger
ports.text: Triggers when any element receives the event

ports.name: Index
ports.text: Index of triggered element in input array
